intro: Monoon erianthoides, commonly known as the white sedge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, often with a white or pale pink coloration. It plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
